name: kafka_consumer_group_lag_incident
description: The Kafka Consumer Group Lag incident refers to a situation where the lag time for a Kafka consumer group exceeds the expected threshold. This delay can result in delayed or lost data processing, leading to service degradation or failure.

cells.name: cell_1
cells.content:
## Kafka Consumer Group Lag Incident
The Kafka Consumer Group Lag incident refers to a situation where the lag time for a Kafka consumer group exceeds the expected threshold. This delay can result in delayed or lost data processing, leading to service degradation or failure.

cells.name: cell_2
cells.content: ## Find out the brokers in the Kafka cluster

cells.name: cell_3
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `kafka-topics.sh --bootstrap-server ${BROKER_HOSTNAME_PORT} --list`

cells.name: cell_4
cells.content: ## Check the status of Kafka brokers and zookeeper

cells.name: cell_5
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `systemctl status kafka zookeeper`

cells.name: cell_6
cells.content: ## Check the consumer group status

cells.name: cell_7
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `kafka-consumer-groups.sh --bootstrap-server ${BROKER_HOSTNAME_PORT} --describe --group ${CONSUMER_GROUP_NAME}`

cells.name: cell_8
cells.content: ## Check the partition lag for the consumer group

cells.name: cell_9
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `kafka-consumer-groups.sh --bootstrap-server ${BROKER_HOSTNAME_PORT} --describe --group ${CONSUMER_GROUP_NAME} | awk 'NR > 1 {print $1"\t"$6}'`

cells.name: cell_10
cells.content: ## Check topics metadata to see if any topics are unbalanced

cells.name: cell_11
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `kafka-topics.sh --bootstrap-server ${BROKER_HOSTNAME_PORT} --describe`

cells.name: cell_12
cells.content: ## Check the disk space usage on the Kafka brokers

cells.name: cell_13
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `df -h`

cells.name: cell_14
cells.content: ## Check the network connectivity between the brokers and the consumer group

cells.name: cell_15
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `ping ${BROKER_HOSTNAME}`

cells.name: cell_16
cells.content: ## Check the Zookeeper logs for any errors

cells.name: cell_17
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `tail -f /var/log/zookeeper/zookeeper.log`

cells.name: cell_18
cells.content: ## Check the Kafka broker logs for any errors

cells.name: cell_19
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `tail -f /var/log/kafka/server.log`

cells.name: cell_20
cells.content: ## One or more Kafka brokers in the cluster are down or experiencing high latency, causing the consumer group to fall behind in processing messages.

cells.name: cell_21
cells.content: host | host_name=$HOST_NAME | invoke_kafka_health_check($PATH_TO_KAFKA_BIN, $KAFKA_TOPIC, $CONSUMER_GROUP_NAME, $ZOOKEEPER_HOST)

cells.name: cell_22
cells.content: ## Increase the number of consumers to handle the load and reduce the lag.

cells.name: cell_23
cells.content: host | host_name=$HOST_NAME | invoke_scale_kafka_consumers($BROKER_HOSTNAME_PORT, $KAFKA_TOPIC, $CONSUMER_GROUP_NAME, $NUMBER_OF_NEW_CONSUMERS)
